page.title: 03Health
page.content: General health is good: there is little stress related illness and the level of heart disease is low. Locals are renowned for there longevity. The children are monitored by a health visitor. The area is part of a community health scheme and the following services are available: Two branch surgeries each week, access to doctors, district nurses, health visitor, physiotherapist, occupational therapist, dietician, clinical psychologist, speech therapist, mental health therapist, community psychiatric care, chiropodist, social worker; plus home help and meals on wheels. The nearest General Hospital is at Gorleston. An area Voluntary Aid Scheme provides transport to health services and offers night sitting.
